Key Match Events: Bangladesh sealed victory over Zimbabwe by three runs in the T20 World Cup after a dramatic final delivery had to be rebowled.
Blessing Muzarabani got a second chance to snatch a win for Zimbabwe but couldn't cash in.
Muzarabani was stumped from the final ball of the match, but the keeper had taken the ball ahead of the stumps.
The umpires called players back on the field to rebowl the last delivery.
Bangladesh opener Najmul Hossain Shanto scored 71 off 55 balls.
Taskin Ahmed's blistering spell of 3-19 inspired the win.
Shakib Al Hasan's run out of Sean Williams was crucial in sealing the win for Bangladesh.
Zimbabwe needed 82 off the final eight overs and Sean Williams (62 off 42) and Ryan Burl (27 off 25) reduced that to 19 off nine balls.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win took Bangladesh to four points in Group Two but they are still to play India and Pakistan.
The loss was a dent to Zimbabwe's finals chances and they remain on three points.
Taskin Ahmed's haul made him the leading wicket taker in the Super 12 segment of the tournament to date, with eight.
Najmul Hossain Shanto posted his highest international score in the format after suffering hamstring issues earlier in his innings.
